sources.description: Title: The Ghost Camera Summary: When a photograph is taken at the scene of a murder, the camera is tossed out of a castle window to destroy the evidence and lands in the back of a passing car belonging to chemist John ... Directed by: Bernard Vorhaus Actors: Henry Kendall, Victor Stanley, John Mills Production Company: Real Art Productions Release Date: 1934 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 When a photograph is taken at the scene of a murder, the camera is tossed out of a castle window to destroy the evidence and lands in the back of a passing car belonging to chemist John Gray who becomes an amateur sleuth after developing the film, and goes in search of the woman captured by the photograph. When the camera is stolen from his laboratory, Gray's suspicions are further aroused.

sources.description: “Splendidly exceptional” “Solid thriller with a great concept” “Surprisingly fun” “Delightful mystery” “A neglected masterpiece” (IMDB reviews quotes). This print is sharper, cleaner and with better contrast than the existing IA copy. A truly unique mystery that’s well-produced and fun thanks to skillful direction, David Lean’s tight editing and a solid all-British cast. Pre-code. In another year the bedroom scene wouldn’t have gotten past the US censors. Recommended. IMDB rating 6.3. Directed by Bernard Vorhaus. Released in 1933 (UK). Complete Print (PAL transfer) CAST NOTE: Ida Lupino’s fifth credited screen role. TRIVIA: First US telecast January 16, 1949 on Boston’s WBZ channel 4.
